articles.title: 4 years after the giant Arecibo Observatory collapsed, we finally know what happened - Space.com
articles.description: A Zinc decay was to blame for cable failures at the Arecibo Observatory, which held the title of "world's largest radio telescope."
articles.content:
What does the discovery
 of a binary pulsar in 1974, the discovery of the first exoplanets
, and the most powerful message humans have ever sent out into space
 all have in common? They all happen… [+3525 chars]
